edu.harvard.util.graph.layout

Class GraphLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.harvard.util.graph.layout.GraphLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FastGraphLayout, SparseGraphLayout

    public abstract class GraphLayout
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A two-dimensional graph layout
    Author:
    Peter Macko
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createStub

        public static GraphLayout createStub(BaseGraph graph,
                                     GraphLayoutAlgorithm algorithm,
                                     java.lang.String description)
        Create a stub for a graph layout from the given graph, algorithm, and description
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph
        algorithm - the graph layout algorithm
        description - the layout description
        Returns:
        an instance of FastGraphLayout just with the layout for the collapsed root summary node

      • loadFromFile

        public static GraphLayout loadFromFile(BaseGraph graph,
                                       java.io.File file,
                                       GraphLayoutAlgorithm algorithm,
                                       JobObserver observer)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Create the object from file. Determine the file format from the file extension
        Parameters:
        graph - the abstract graph this layout is for
        file - the file object
        algorithm - the graph layout algorithm that produced the layout (can be null if necessary)
        observer - the job progress observer
        Returns:
        the new object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred

      • updateFromFile

        public void updateFromFile(java.io.File file,
                           JobObserver observer)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Update the layout from the information stored in the given file. Determine the file format from the file extension
        Parameters:
        file - the file object
        observer - the job progress observer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • updateFromStream

        public void updateFromStream(java.io.InputStream stream,
                             java.lang.String format,
                             JobObserver observer)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Update the layout from the information loaded from the given stream
        Parameters:
        stream - the input stream
        format - the input format (the file extension of the input file)
        observer - the job progress observer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • importLayout

        public void importLayout(GraphLayout layout,
                         boolean overwrite)
        Import layout information from another layout from the same graph
        Parameters:
        layout - the layout to import (warning: it will be modified destructively)
        overwrite - whether to overwrite local information in the case of conflict
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the two layouts are not for the same graph

      • moveRelatively

        public void moveRelatively(double dx,
                           double dy)
        Move the contents of the entire graph layout relatively to their current positions
        Parameters:
        dx - the shift in the X direction
        dy - the shift in the Y direction

      • centerAt

        public void centerAt(double x,
                     double y)
        Move the graph contents so that the center of the graph is at the given coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - the new X-coordinate of the center of the graph
        y - the new Y-coordinate of the center of the graph

        Parameters:

        sy - the scale on the Y axis
